results.title: Driving to a system
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “How to Drive”.
The drills of the system of car control demonstrated have been well tried and are well proven; once memorised and understood, the system soon becomes an almost instinctive routine. The system is designed to ensure that at all times the car is in the right place on the road, travelling at the right speed for existing conditions, in the right gear, and the driver is never trying to do more than one thing at a time.

results.title: Double trouble
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Geoffrey Bell and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Designed to establish cordial relations between Australians and migrants from Europe. Two Australian who criticise the newcomers’ lack of English find themselves in serious difficulties when magically transported to a foreign country.

results.title: Don't lose your grip
results.creator_credit: Joan Hansen, R.D. Hansen, Fortune Film Productions and New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1961 film illustrates safe methods for handling and storage of rolled steel joists, angles and plates in steel yards. Accompanied by an instructional narration, the film opens with a dramatised scene of an injured man caught beneath a steel beam due to the carelessness of a workmate. It shows footage of correct methods of stacking and storing steel beams, angles and plates, as well as demonstrating correct use of lifting equipment.

Produced by Fortune Film Productions and the New South Wales Department of Labour and Industry.

There are several jumps in the soundtrack throughout the film due to missing frames.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Forward communications
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Stresses that Australia’s vast distances make an efficient system of communication most essential. Shows how the Post Office is maintaining our present communications system at a high level of efficiency and also how the heavy post-war demand for new telephones and exchanges is being met.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bern Gandy and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Depending on weather
results.brief_description: A driver’s safety depends on the reliability of their car and on their knowledge and experience. As winter approaches racing driver David Mackay checks his car’s reliability to face all weather conditions.

results.title: A Demonstration of basic film techniques
results.brief_description: Designed to serve as a practical aid for teachers presenting a course in film appreciation. Experience has shown that one of the first barriers to be broken down in such a course is the students’ ignorance of the fact that a film is MADE, that it is the result of conscious decision by the film maker. Teachers may use it to demonstrate the more common shots in film making. They may use it to establish the idea of film editing - the joining together of separate shots into a meaningful unit. The film’s deficiencies and faults should serve as valuable teaching points during discussion after the film.

results.title: Defensive riding techniques
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Defensive riding is avoiding accidents by foreseeing possible dangers and taking appropriate action. Gives three short rules: firstly, try to anticipate and, therefore, avoid mistakes of other motorists; secondly, drive defensively, and heed all traffic rules and signals; thirdly, make sure you can be seen at all times.

results.title: Dear mum
results.creator_credit: Don Marley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Cinesound Movietone
results.brief_description: A highly entertaining and at times funny film about the life of a young soldier in the army. He writes to tell his mum all the great things that happen in the army - like seeing the country; friendship; a lot of spare time and the satisfaction from working as a group.

results.title: The Davis Cup, 1951
results.brief_description: The story of Australia’s fight to retain the world tennis premiership. The film covers the Interzone Final in Melbourne between Sweden and the USA and the Challenge Round in Sydney between the USA and Australia. Narrated by Michael Charlton and Peter Whitchurch.

results.title: David and Jennifer Learn Their Kerb Drill
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small, John Martin-Jones, Australian Road Safety Council and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: David and Jennifer are sent on messages to a shop across a busy street. Their mother carefully explains the meaning of the traffic lights. They sing a safety song to remember the newly learnt rules.
